channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024120031
item.description:
Report E-2024120031

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallond drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Coastal Environmental Solutions (CES) to remediate the impacted site. CES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the ink-impacted trailer floor. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon overpack and all impacted waste and absorbents collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report E-2024120028
item.description:
Report E-2024120028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately fifty (50) gallons to the trailer floor. R_L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed a neutralizer to the trailer floor around the damaged drum. The crew collected the damaged drum, then placed all UN2922-impacted materials into one (1) 95-gallon overpack.
